Articles.Content:
KSP Version: 0.90 Windows 32-bit

What Happens: I become unable to edit or launch the craft

Mods / Add-Ons: All stock

Steps to Replicate: (I am uncertain about the steps, so I'll describe what I did)

I was making a plane in the SPH, when, after reverting to the SPH after a round of testing, I discovered that the plane was bugged. I reverted from a killed EVA'ed kerbal while the plane was still flying on SAS. I previously had a minor problem similar to this one on the same plane, where I couldn't retract the ladders, but I didn't think much of it. I also got some shock cone intakes on radial attachment ports clipped inside the cabin, and I think my problem may be something to do with that.

Result: All the other stock planes work just fine, and I can load, save, and begin new spacecraft from this plane in the SPH, but if I load this particular one, I am unable to exit, move, rotate, root or offset any parts (when I try to do so the parts are just highlighted in blue), nor can I place new parts (when I click a part it just places itself somewhere around the area I clicked in the SPH despite having clicked on the menu). When I try to launch, it doesn't do anything other than make the buttons on the top right, symmetry mode, crew, action groups, parts and angle snap unclickable, making me have to terminate the task using task manager.

Whenever I load the craft, the menu messes up and I have to click on action groups or crew to fix it. I've put an image of this below.

Other Notes/Pictures/Log Files:

Craft file link: http://www./download/dzn7om7k594ruan/The_Manta_Ray.craft

Edited March 21, 2015 by Manu11299
Forgot to follow bug reporting template + forgot minor relevant details + located installation folder

I can't fix it, it isn't editable and I can't save it on my system, I don't know what has caused this but I suspect something is missing from the craft file.

I think you are going to have to rebuild it, sorry.
